alert.note: Alert for North Fork (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 22 at 1:56AM MDT until June 22 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 292... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 292... * AFFECTED AREA...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 292 North Fork Forecast Area. * WINDS...Southwest winds 15 to 25 with gusts to 35 mph this afternoon. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts over 40 mph Friday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Conditions will likely be favorable for easy ignition and rapid spread of fires due to low relative humidity and strong gusty winds.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
